SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.openflow.protocol
Class Wildcards

java.lang.Object
  org.openflow.protocol.Wildcards

public class Wildcards
extends java.lang.Object

a more user friendly representation of the wildcards bits in an OpenFlow match. The Wildcards object is

  • immutable (i.e., threadsafe)
  • instance managed (don't instantiate it yourself), instead call "of"

      • You can construct a Wildcard object from either its integer representation

      Wildcard.of(0x3820e0);

      Or start with either an empty or full wildcard, and select/unselect foo.

      Wildcard w = Wildcards.NONE .set(Flag.DL_SRC, Flag. DL_DST, Flag.DL_VLAN_PCP) .setNwDstMask(8) .setNwSrcMask(8);

      Remember: Wildcards objects are immutable. set... operations have NO EFFECT on the current wildcard object. You HAVE to use the returned changed object.

      Author:
      Andreas Wundsam

                enum type for the binary flags that can be set in the wildcards field of an OFMatch.

      of

      public static Wildcards of(int paramFlags)
      return a wildcard object matching the given int flags. May reuse / cache frequently used wildcard instances. Don't rely on it though (use equals not ==).

      Parameters:
      flags -
      Returns:

      getNwSrcMask

      withNwSrcMask

      public Wildcards withNwSrcMask(int srcCidrMask)
      return a Wildcard object that has the given nwSrcCidrMask set. NOTE: NOT a mutator function. 'this' wildcard object stays unmodified.

      Parameters:
      srcCidrMask - source mask to set in normal CIDR notation, i.e., 8 means x.x.x.x/8
      Returns:
      a modified object

      withNwDstMask

      public Wildcards withNwDstMask(int dstCidrMask)
      return a Wildcard object that has the given nwDstCidrMask set. NOTE: NOT a mutator function. 'this' wildcard object stays unmodified.

      Parameters:
      dstCidrMask - dest mask to set in normal CIDR notation, i.e., 8 means x.x.x.x/8
      Returns:
      a modified object

      inverted

      public Wildcards inverted()
      return a Wildcard object that is inverted to this wildcard object. NOTE: NOT a mutator function. 'this' wildcard object stays unmodified.

      Returns:
      a modified object

      isWildcarded

      public boolean isWildcarded(Wildcards.Flag flag)

      getWildcardedFlags

      public java.util.EnumSet<Wildcards.Flag> getWildcardedFlags()
      return all wildcard flags that are fully wildcarded as an EnumSet. Do not modify. Note: some flags (like NW_SRC and NW_DST) that are partially wildcarded are not returned in this set.

      Returns:
      the EnumSet of wildcards

      getInt

      public int getInt()
      return the OpenFlow 'wire' integer representation of these wildcards

      sanitizeInt

      public static int sanitizeInt(int flags)
      return the OpenFlow 'wire' integer representation of these wildcards. Sanitize nw_src and nw_dst to be max. 32 (values > 32 are technically possible, but don't make semantic sense)

      isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      is this a wildcard set that has all flags set + and full (/0) nw_src and nw_dst wildcarding ?

      isExact

      public boolean isExact()
      is this a wildcard of an exact match
